SavedLv2_00:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>That was amazing.<sp:5:0:0> You're so strong!<sp:5:0:0> I bet
evil always scatters when you show up!
SavedLv2_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad_00>My bug collecting was already going
badly, so being attacked was just a
sting on top of a bug bite.
Talk99_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>We meet again! I hope you're well! <sp:5:1:0>I am,
as always, on the hunt for more bugs!

Since we're both here, let me buzz your
ears with some <clr:0000>bug facts<clr:ffff>!
GoodBye00:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>I, Wadder, am wandering all throughout
Hyrule collecting bugs.

Are you perhaps also a fan of insects?<sp:0:4:0><snd:Happy_01>Honestly, how could you not be? From
their beautiful wings paired to their tough
exoskeletons... What perfect creatures.
Oh! I've got it. As thanks for your help, let
me gift you my <clr:0000>knowledge of all things
Insecta<clr:ffff>!<sp:5:1:0> That's a sciencey name for bugs.
<snd:LaughS>You're traveling around Hyrule too, so
such wisdom will help you find all sorts of
bugs on your journey!
TerrorEnemy_01: I want to run away, but...
GoodBye00_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Are you enjoying your own travels? Are
you catching every last bug you see?<sp:5:1:0>
I certainly try to!
Since we're both here, let me buzz your
ears with some bug facts!
Atacked00:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Um, sorry...<sp:5:0:0> Could you please not bug me
while I'm in the middle of this?
Atacked01: <sp:3:0:2:0900>Who put bees in your bonnet, huh?!
Talk01_00_00:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:TalkPositive>You'll find <clr:0000>thunderwing butterflies <clr:ffff>and
<clr:0000>electric darners<clr:ffff> here in Ludfo's Bog!
Talk01_00_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:TalkPositive>There are <clr:0000>thunderwing butterflies<clr:ffff> and
<clr:0000>electric darners<clr:ffff> around here and in
Faron to the west.
Talk06_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive>Check on tree trunks <clr:0000>at night<clr:ffff> if you're
hunting for rhino beetles! <sp:5:0:0>There's a few
different kinds to look for.
First, there's <clr:0000>bladed rhino beetles<clr:ffff>, which
can be made into really useful muscle-
stimulating elixirs.
On the other hand, <clr:0000>rugged rhino beetles<clr:ffff>
can really toughen up someone's body if
they're used in elixirs instead!
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>But both are dull compared to the
<clr:0000>energetic rhino beetles<clr:ffff>. I mean that
literallyâ€”they have golden bodies!
If that excites you, make a note that
energetic rhino beetles are found in the
Akkala and eastern Faron regions.
<snd:Happy_01>Such an amazing bug... I really can't help
but admire it.
Guardian00:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseL_01>I recognize that this is a selfish request,
and I really don't mean to bug you, but...<sp:5:0:0>
Save meee!
Talk01_00_02:
Throw either of them in a pot with some
monster parts, and you can make yourself
elixirs that give electricity resistance.
<snd:LaughS>Of course, I can't bring myself to do that,
no matter how stormy it might get. I just
love my bug buddies too much!
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy>Speaking of storms, <clr:0000>daytime rain showers<clr:ffff>
are the perfect time to find thunderwing
butterflies and electric darners.
<snd:Happy>You don't need compound eyes to pay
close attention to the weather and the
time of day!
Talk03_00:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive><clr:0000>Winterwing butterflies<clr:ffff> and <clr:0000>cold darners<clr:ffff>
call chilly regions like this home.

They actually can be combined with
monster parts in a pot to make a heat-
resistance elixir, if you can believe it!
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy>I prefer to watch <clr:0000>winterwing butterflies<clr:ffff>
glide through the snowy air. They're such
graceful creatures.
I can't count the number of times I've
gotten so caught up watching them that
I've lost my way in the mountains!
Failed00:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Ease>Ugh...<sp:5:0:0> It felt like I was nearly squashed
there. I'm lucky I'm still breathing.
Talk03_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive>If you look around, you'll definitely be
able to find <clr:0000>cold darners<clr:ffff> in this region.

Which is handy, since you can combine
them with monster parts in a pot to make
a heat-resistance elixir!
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>I've been looking to get my hands on one,
but they keep slipping through my grasp.

<snd:Think_00>I know it pays to chill out when you're
trying to catch insects, but I'm finding it
really tough to tone down my excitement.
SavedLv3_00:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>You look like a gentle soul who wouldn't
hurt anything, but you're really strong!
Failed01:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Ease>I was so focused on catching bugs that
I didn't notice I was about to be the one
getting caught!
Thanks00:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Here, this is one of my favorite foods.
Would you take some as thanks for
helping me?
Talk02_00:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive>Here in the Eldin region, you can find
<clr:0000>smotherwing butterflies<clr:ffff> scattered around
Death Mountain!
These rare beauties really, really love
volcanic areas where the temperatures
are soaring!
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>However, you can also find <clr:0000>summerwing
butterflies<clr:ffff> and <clr:0000>warm darners<clr:ffff> around here.

<sp:3:0:2:0001>So if you're just looking for smotherwing
butterflies, you need to look for their
<clr:0000>black wings<clr:ffff> with a <clr:0000>flame pattern<clr:ffff>.
Commit a bug's features to memory and
you'll be sure to grab the right ones!

<sp:3:0:2:0800>Unless you're me. Then they're all the
right ones! Ha!
SavedLv1_00:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy>You're strong.<sp:5:0:0> Tougher than a beetle's
shell and sharper than a mantis's claw!
SavedLv3_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Ease>Did a little bug tell you I was in danger?<sp:5:1:0>
You came to rescue me just in time.
Thanks01:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Let me give you this as thanks for your
help. It's great to eat even when you're
on the road!
Talk00_00:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>OK, let's start with the basics.<sp:0:4:0><snd:Think_01>I'm sure you know that Hyrule has warm
regions and cold regions, right?

<sp:3:0:2:0001>Well, just like most folks, our different
buggy friends prefer different climates
depending on their needs.
So warm regions like Eldin are often
home to <clr:0000>summerwing butterflies<clr:ffff> and
<clr:0000>warm darners<clr:ffff>.
Meanwhile, <clr:0000>cold darners<clr:ffff> and <clr:0000>winterwing
butterflies<clr:ffff> prefer cold regions like Hebra.

<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS_00>So you see, if you know what kind of bugs
live where you're heading, it makes the
journey that much more fun!
Talk02_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Greeting_00>Here in the Eldin region, you can find
<clr:0000>smotherwing butterflies<clr:ffff> scattered around
Death Mountain!
However, you can also find <clr:0000>summerwing
butterflies<clr:ffff> and <clr:0000>warm darners<clr:ffff> around here.

So if you're just looking for smotherwing
butterflies, you need to look for their
<clr:0000>black wings<clr:ffff> with a <clr:0000>flame pattern<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:TalkPositive>Commit a bug's features to memory and
you'll be sure to grab the right ones!
SavedLv1_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Welp, I guess that's over. <sp:5:1:0>Honestly, I've
been attacked by bees that were scarier.
AfterFailed:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Ugh...<sp:5:0:0> I still feel so dizzy...<sp:5:1:0> Just let me
rest, please.
Thanks02:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Thank you for saving me. Can I give you
this to show my thanks?
Talk00_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>Just like most folks, our different buggy
friends prefer different climates
depending on their needs.
So warm regions like Eldin are often
home to <clr:0000>summerwing butterflies<clr:ffff> and
<clr:0000>warm darners<clr:ffff>.
Meanwhile, <clr:0000>cold darners<clr:ffff> and <clr:0000>winterwing
butterflies<clr:ffff> prefer cold regions like Hebra.

<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Happy>So you see, if you know what kind of bugs
live where you're heading, it makes the
journey that much more fun!
Talk07_00_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think>Have you ever been crawling along,
preparing to pounce on that perfect bug,
when it fled from a <clr:0000>sound <clr:ffff>you made?
<sp:3:0:2:0000>Well, I've got a great tip to share with
you! You've heard of <clr:0000>Kakariko Village<clr:ffff>
in Necluda, right?
Rumor has it they sell clothing that helps
you sneak about without a sound. It's
called the <clr:0000>stealth chest guard<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Apparently it uses ancient technology!
Kind of sounds like a spy gadget... <sp:5:0:0>Maybe
some day I'll own a piece of my own.
Thanks03:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I have to thank you somehow for saving
me. <sp:5:1:0>Will you accept this?
Talk07_00_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseM>That pattern on your tunic... That smooth,
form-fitting shape... <sp:5:1:0>Could that possibly
be the <clr:0000>stealth chest guard<clr:ffff>?
<sp:3:0:2:0000>I'm jealous!<sp:5:1:0> But also really happy for you!<sp:5:1:0>
You're sure to have an easier time
sneaking up on bugs with that on!
Talk05:
<clr:0000><sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive>Sunset fireflies<clr:ffff> tend to come out <clr:0000>at night<clr:ffff>
near bodies of water.

Keep your eyes peeled for little lights
floating in the airâ€”those little blazing
beauties are easy to spot in the dark!
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy>It's really a magical thing to witness.
Everyone should see it at least once in
their lives...
Talk06:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive>Have you heard of rhino beetles? They
like to hang out on <clr:0000>tree trunks<clr:ffff>, but it's
possible to quietly sneak up on them.
There are a number of different kinds in
Hyrule, you know, and they all have
fascinating uses!
There are <clr:0000>bladed rhino beetles<clr:ffff>, which can
be made into muscle-stimulating elixirs...

On the other hand, <clr:0000>rugged rhino beetles<clr:ffff>
can really toughen up someone's body if
they're used in elixirs instead!
<sp:3:0:2:0800>But both are dull compared to the
<clr:0000>energetic rhino beetles<clr:ffff>. I mean that
literallyâ€”they have golden bodies!
If that excites you, make a note that
energetic rhino beetles are found in
the Akkala and eastern Faron regions.
<snd:TalkPositive_01>Oh! One more thing... Rhino beetles don't
come out during the day. <clr:0000>Nighttime <clr:ffff>is
your friend if you're looking for them!
Talk08:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Think>Have you heard the rumors about a new
bug being discovered? Apparently they're
found in those <clr:0000>chasms<clr:ffff> that opened up.
The bug's like nothing else they've seen!
And!<sp:5:0:0> <clr:0000>Mixing it into an elixir<clr:ffff> has the
peculiar effect of <clr:0000>making your body glow<clr:ffff>!
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy>Few things make me happier than learning
about new, bug-related discoveries!

I wish I could be right there, taking in all
the new bug research, but I hear the
chasms are really dangerous...
Talk08_01:

Talk07_01:

I hear it makes you sneaky as a spy.
Which means you could creep up on
bugs easily!
<snd:Ease_01>An outfit that uses ancient technology to

monster parts and you can make yourself
elixirs that give electricity resistance!
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Just don't forget that they only appear on

Talk100:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:LaughS_01>And that's it for Dr. Wadder's Insect
Crash Course!<sp:5:1:0> I hope we meet again
somewhere soon!
Talk04_00:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive>Have you run into any <clr:0000>restless crickets<clr:ffff>
when you've idly slashed at grass? That
tends to stir them up.
But only if you're using something sharp
to cut the grass!

I've found that even a wooden stick with a
sharp rock for a blade will do the trick.

<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_00>Anyone can aspire to catching bugs, but
only the truly resourceful will master
the art!
Talk99:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Say, are you a fellow traveler?<sp:0:4:0>I, Wadder, am wandering all throughout
Hyrule collecting <clr:0000>bugs<clr:ffff>.

Are you perhaps also a fan of insects?<sp:0:4:0><snd:Happy_01>Honestly, how could you not be? From
their beautiful wings paired to their tough
exoskeletons... What perfect creatures.
Oh! As a gift for a fellow traveler, let me
share my <clr:0000>knowledge of all things Insecta<clr:ffff>!
<sp:5:1:0>That's a sciencey name for bugs.
<snd:LaughS>I'm sure such wisdom will help you find
all sorts of bugs on your journey!
Talk04_01:
<clr:0000><sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive>Restless crickets <clr:ffff>prefer to hide in

If you're looking for them, you can make
a tool to <clr:0000>cut grass<clr:ffff> by combining a <clr:0000>sharp
rock<clr:ffff> and, say, a wooden stick!
